domains.description: Console domain defines methods and events for interaction with the JavaScript console. Console collects messages created by means of the JavaScript Console API. One needs to enable this domain using enable command in order to start receiving the console messages. Browser collects messages issued while console domain is not enabled as well and reports them using messageAdded notification upon enabling.

types.description: Channels for different types of log messages.
The reason the console is being cleared.

properties.name: level
properties.description: Message severity.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Message text.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Console message type.

properties.name: url
properties.description: URL of the message origin.

properties.name: line
properties.description: Line number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: column
properties.description: Column number on the line in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: repeatCount
properties.description: Repeat count for repeated messages.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Message parameters in case of the formatted message.

properties.name: stackTrace
properties.description: JavaScript stack trace for assertions and error messages.

properties.name: networkRequestId
properties.description: Identifier of the network request associated with this message.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: Time when this message was added. Currently only used when an expensive operation happens to make sure that the frontend can account for it.

types.description: Stack entry for console errors and assertions.

properties.name: functionName
properties.description: JavaScript function name.

properties.name: url
properties.description: JavaScript script name or url.

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script identifier.

properties.name: lineNumber
properties.description: JavaScript script line number.

properties.name: columnNumber
properties.description: JavaScript script column number.

types.description: Call frames for async function calls, console assertions, and error messages.

properties.name: topCallFrameIsBoundary
properties.description: Whether the first item in callFrames is the native function that scheduled the asynchronous operation (e.g. setTimeout).

properties.name: truncated
properties.description: Whether one or more frames have been truncated from the bottom of the stack.

properties.name: parentStackTrace
properties.description: Parent StackTrace.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables console domain, sends the messages collected so far to the client by means of the messageAdded notification.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables console domain, prevents further console messages from being reported to the client.

commands.name: clearMessages
commands.description: Clears console messages collected in the browser.

commands.name: getLoggingChannels
commands.description: List of the different message sources that are non-default logging channels.

commands.name: setLoggingChannelLevel
commands.description: Modify the level of a channel.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Logging channel to modify.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: New level.

events.name: messageAdded
events.description: Issued when new console message is added.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Console message that has been added.

events.name: messageRepeatCountUpdated
events.description: Issued when subsequent message(s) are equal to the previous one(s).

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: New repeat count value.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of the latest message.

events.name: messagesCleared
events.description: Issued when console is cleared. This happens either upon clearMessages command or after page navigation.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason the console is being cleared.

events.name: heapSnapshot
events.description: Issued from console.takeHeapSnapshot.

parameters.name: snapshotData
parameters.description: Snapshot at the end of tracking.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Optional title provided to console.takeHeapSnapshot.

domains.description: CPUProfiler domain exposes cpu usage tracking.

types.description: CPU usage for an individual thread.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Some thread identification information.

properties.name: usage
properties.description: CPU usage for this thread. This should not exceed 100% for an individual thread.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of thread. There should be a single main thread.

properties.name: targetId
properties.description: A thread may be associated with a target, such as a Worker, in the process.

properties.name: usage
properties.description: Percent of total cpu usage. If there are multiple cores the usage may be greater than 100%.

properties.name: threads
properties.description: Per-thread CPU usage information. Does not include the main thread.

commands.name: startTracking
commands.description: Start tracking cpu usage.

commands.name: stopTracking
commands.description: Stop tracking cpu usage. This will produce a `trackingComplete` event.

events.name: trackingStart
events.description: Tracking started.

events.name: trackingUpdate
events.description: Periodic tracking updates with event data.

events.name: trackingComplete
events.description: Tracking stopped.

domains.description: Debugger domain exposes JavaScript debugging capabilities. It allows setting and removing breakpoints, stepping through execution, exploring stack traces, etc.

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script identifier as reported in the Debugger.scriptParsed.

properties.name: lineNumber
properties.description: Line number in the script (0-based).

properties.name: columnNumber
properties.description: Column number in the script (0-based).

types.description: Action to perform when a breakpoint is triggered.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Different kinds of breakpoint actions.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Data associated with this breakpoint type (e.g. for type "eval" this is the JavaScript string to evaluate).

properties.name: id
properties.description: A frontend-assigned identifier for this breakpoint action.

properties.name: emulateUserGesture
properties.description: Indicates whether this action should be executed with a user gesture or not. Defaults to <code>false<code>.

types.description: Extra options that modify breakpoint behavior.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: Expression to use as a breakpoint condition. When specified, debugger will only stop on the breakpoint if this expression evaluates to true.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: Actions to perform automatically when the breakpoint is triggered.

properties.name: autoContinue
properties.description: Automatically continue after hitting this breakpoint and running actions.

properties.name: ignoreCount
properties.description: Number of times to ignore this breakpoint, before stopping on the breakpoint and running actions.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Location of the function.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the function. Not present for anonymous functions.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: Display name of the function(specified in 'displayName' property on the function object).

properties.name: scopeChain
properties.description: Scope chain for this closure.

types.description: JavaScript call frame. Array of call frames form the call stack.

properties.name: callFrameId
properties.description: Call frame identifier. This identifier is only valid while the virtual machine is paused.

properties.name: functionName
properties.description: Name of the JavaScript function called on this call frame.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Location in the source code.

properties.name: scopeChain
properties.description: Scope chain for this call frame.

properties.name: this
properties.description: this object for this call frame.

properties.name: isTailDeleted
properties.description: Is the current frame tail deleted from a tail call.

properties.name: object
properties.description: Object representing the scope. For global and with scopes it represents the actual object; for the rest of the scopes, it is artificial transient object enumerating scope variables as its properties.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name associated with the scope.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Location if available of the scope definition.

properties.name: empty
properties.description: Whether the scope has any variables.

types.description: A sample collected by evaluating a probe breakpoint action.

properties.name: probeId
properties.description: Identifier of the probe breakpoint action that created the sample.

properties.name: sampleId
properties.description: Unique identifier for this sample.

properties.name: batchId
properties.description: A batch identifier which is the same for all samples taken at the same breakpoint hit.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: Timestamp of when the sample was taken.

properties.name: payload
properties.description: Contents of the sample.

types.description: The pause reason auxiliary data when paused because of an assertion.

properties.name: message
properties.description: The console.assert message string if provided.

types.description: The pause reason auxiliary data when paused because of hitting a breakpoint.

properties.name: breakpointId
properties.description: The identifier of the breakpoint causing the pause.

types.description: The pause reason auxiliary data when paused because of a Content Security Policy directive.

properties.name: directive
properties.description: The CSP directive that blocked script execution.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables debugger for the given page. Clients should not assume that the debugging has been enabled until the result for this command is received.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables debugger for given page.

commands.name: setAsyncStackTraceDepth
commands.description: Set the async stack trace depth for the page. A value of zero disables recording of async stack traces.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Async stack trace depth.

commands.name: setBreakpointsActive
commands.description: Activates / deactivates all breakpoints on the page.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: New value for breakpoints active state.

commands.name: setBreakpointByUrl
commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at given location specified either by URL or URL regex. Once this command is issued, all existing parsed scripts will have breakpoints resolved and returned in locations property. Further matching script parsing will result in subsequent breakpointResolved events issued. This logical breakpoint will survive page reloads.

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Line number to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resources to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: urlRegex
parameters.description: Regex pattern for the URLs of the resources to set breakpoints on. Either url or urlRegex must be specified.

parameters.name: columnNumber
parameters.description: Offset in the line to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further reference.

returns.name: locations
returns.description: List of the locations this breakpoint resolved into upon addition.

commands.name: setBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at a given location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location to set breakpoint in.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further reference.

commands.name: removeBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes JavaScript breakpoint.

commands.name: addSymbolicBreakpoint
commands.description: Adds a JavaScript breakpoint that pauses execution whenever a function with the given name is about to be called.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The name of the function to pause in when called.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: If true, symbol is case sensitive. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: If true, treats symbol as a regex. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

commands.name: removeSymbolicBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes a previously added symbolic breakpoint.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The name of the function to pause in when called.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: If true, symbol is case sensitive. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: If true, treats symbol as a regex. Defaults to false.

commands.name: continueUntilNextRunLoop
commands.description: Continues execution until the current evaluation completes. This will trigger either a Debugger.paused or Debugger.resumed event.

commands.name: continueToLocation
commands.description: Continues execution until specific location is reached. This will trigger either a Debugger.paused or Debugger.resumed event.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location to continue to.

commands.name: stepNext
commands.description: Steps over the expression. This will trigger either a Debugger.paused or Debugger.resumed event.

commands.name: stepOver
commands.description: Steps over the statement. This will trigger either a Debugger.paused or Debugger.resumed event.

commands.name: stepInto
commands.description: Steps into the function call. This will trigger either a Debugger.paused or Debugger.resumed event.

commands.name: stepOut
commands.description: Steps out of the function call. This will trigger either a Debugger.paused or Debugger.resumed event.

commands.name: pause
commands.description: Stops on the next JavaScript statement.

commands.name: resume
commands.description: Resumes JavaScript execution. This will trigger a Debugger.resumed event.

commands.name: searchInContent
commands.description: Searches for given string in script content.

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Id of the script to search in.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: String to search for.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: If true, search is case sensitive.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: If true, treats string parameter as regex.

commands.name: getScriptSource
commands.description: Returns source for the script with given id.

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Id of the script to get source for.

commands.name: getFunctionDetails
commands.description: Returns detailed information on given function.

parameters.name: functionId
parameters.description: Id of the function to get location for.

commands.name: getBreakpointLocations
commands.description: Returns a list of valid breakpoint locations within the given location range.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starting location to look for breakpoint locations after (inclusive). Must have same scriptId as end.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Ending location to look for breakpoint locations before (exclusive). Must have same scriptId as start.

commands.name: setPauseOnDebuggerStatements
commands.description: Control whether the debugger pauses execution before `debugger` statements.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

commands.name: setPauseOnExceptions
commands.description: Defines pause on exceptions state. Can be set to stop on all exceptions, uncaught exceptions or no exceptions. Initial pause on exceptions state is none.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Pause on exceptions mode.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

commands.name: setPauseOnAssertions
commands.description: Set pause on assertions state. Assertions are console.assert assertions.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

commands.name: setPauseOnMicrotasks
commands.description: Pause when running the next JavaScript microtask.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

commands.name: setPauseForInternalScripts
commands.description: Change whether to pause in the debugger for internal scripts. The default value is false.

commands.name: evaluateOnCallFrame
commands.description: Evaluates expression on a given call frame.

parameters.name: callFrameId
parameters.description: Call frame identifier to evaluate on.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: Expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: String object group name to put result into (allows rapid releasing resulting object handles using releaseObjectGroup).

parameters.name: includeCommandLineAPI
parameters.description: Specifies whether command line API should be available to the evaluated expression, defaults to false.

parameters.name: doNotPauseOnExceptionsAndMuteConsole
parameters.description: Specifies whether evaluation should stop on exceptions and mute console. Overrides setPauseOnException state.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object that should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

parameters.name: saveResult
parameters.description: Whether the resulting value should be considered for saving in the $n history.

parameters.name: emulateUserGesture
parameters.description: Whether the expression should be considered to be in a user gesture or not.

returns.name: result
returns.description: Object wrapper for the evaluation result.

returns.name: wasThrown
returns.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

returns.name: savedResultIndex
returns.description: If the result was saved, this is the $n index that can be used to access the value.

commands.name: setShouldBlackboxURL
commands.description: Sets whether the given URL should be in the list of blackboxed scripts, which are ignored when pausing/stepping/debugging.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: If true, url is case sensitive.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: If true, treat url as regular expression.

commands.name: setBlackboxBreakpointEvaluations
commands.description: Sets whether evaluation of breakpoint conditions, ignore counts, and actions happen at the location of the breakpoint or are deferred due to blackboxing.

events.name: globalObjectCleared
events.description: Called when global has been cleared and debugger client should reset its state. Happens upon navigation or reload.

events.name: scriptParsed
events.description: Fired when virtual machine parses script. This event is also fired for all known and uncollected scripts upon enabling debugger.

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Identifier of the script parsed.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the script parsed (if any).

parameters.name: startLine
parameters.description: Line offset of the script within the resource with given URL (for script tags).

parameters.name: startColumn
parameters.description: Column offset of the script within the resource with given URL.

parameters.name: endLine
parameters.description: Last line of the script.

parameters.name: endColumn
parameters.description: Length of the last line of the script.

parameters.name: isContentScript
parameters.description: Determines whether this script is a user extension script.

parameters.name: sourceURL
parameters.description: sourceURL name of the script (if any).

parameters.name: sourceMapURL
parameters.description: URL of source map associated with script (if any).

parameters.name: module
parameters.description: True if this script was parsed as a module.

events.name: scriptFailedToParse
events.description: Fired when virtual machine fails to parse the script.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the script that failed to parse.

parameters.name: scriptSource
parameters.description: Source text of the script that failed to parse.

parameters.name: startLine
parameters.description: Line offset of the script within the resource.

parameters.name: errorLine
parameters.description: Line with error.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.description: Parse error message.

events.name: breakpointResolved
events.description: Fired when breakpoint is resolved to an actual script and location.

parameters.name: breakpointId
parameters.description: Breakpoint unique identifier.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Actual breakpoint location.

events.name: paused
events.description: Fired when the virtual machine stopped on breakpoint or exception or any other stop criteria.

parameters.name: callFrames
parameters.description: Call stack the virtual machine stopped on.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Pause reason.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Object containing break-specific auxiliary properties.

parameters.name: asyncStackTrace
parameters.description: Linked list of asynchronous StackTraces.

events.name: resumed
events.description: Fired when the virtual machine resumed execution.

events.name: didSampleProbe
events.description: Fires when a new probe sample is collected.

parameters.name: sample
parameters.description: A collected probe sample.

events.name: playBreakpointActionSound
events.description: Fired when a "sound" breakpoint action is triggered on a breakpoint.

parameters.name: breakpointActionId
parameters.description: Breakpoint action identifier.

domains.description: Exposes generic types to be used by any domain.

properties.name: lineNumber
properties.description: Line number in resource content.

properties.name: lineContent
properties.description: Line with match content.

domains.description: Heap domain exposes JavaScript heap attributes and capabilities.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of garbage collection.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables Heap domain events.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables Heap domain events.

commands.name: gc
commands.description: Trigger a full garbage collection.

commands.name: snapshot
commands.description: Take a heap snapshot.

commands.name: startTracking
commands.description: Start tracking heap changes. This will produce a `trackingStart` event.

commands.name: stopTracking
commands.description: Stop tracking heap changes. This will produce a `trackingComplete` event.

commands.name: getPreview
commands.description: Returns a preview (string, Debugger.FunctionDetails, or Runtime.ObjectPreview) for a Heap.HeapObjectId.

parameters.name: heapObjectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the heap object within the snapshot.

commands.name: getRemoteObject
commands.description: Returns the strongly referenced Runtime.RemoteObject for a Heap.HeapObjectId.

parameters.name: heapObjectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the heap object within the snapshot.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name that can be used to release multiple objects.

events.name: garbageCollected
events.description: Information about the garbage collection.

events.name: trackingStart
events.description: Tracking started.

parameters.name: snapshotData
parameters.description: Snapshot at the start of tracking.

events.name: trackingComplete
events.description: Tracking stopped.

parameters.name: snapshotData
parameters.description: Snapshot at the end of tracking.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables inspector domain notifications.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables inspector domain notifications.

commands.name: initialized
commands.description: Sent by the frontend after all initialization messages have been sent.

domains.description: Network domain allows tracking network activities of the page. It exposes information about http, file, data and other requests and responses, their headers, bodies, timing, etc.

types.description: Controls how much referrer information is sent with the request
Request / response headers as keys / values of JSON object.

properties.name: startTime
properties.description: Request is initiated

properties.name: redirectStart
properties.description: Started redirect resolution.

properties.name: redirectEnd
properties.description: Finished redirect resolution.

properties.name: fetchStart
properties.description: Resource fetching started.

properties.name: domainLookupStart
properties.description: Started DNS address resolve in milliseconds relative to fetchStart.

properties.name: domainLookupEnd
properties.description: Finished DNS address resolve in milliseconds relative to fetchStart.

properties.name: connectStart
properties.description: Started connecting to the remote host in milliseconds relative to fetchStart.

properties.name: connectEnd
properties.description: Connected to the remote host in milliseconds relative to fetchStart.

properties.name: secureConnectionStart
properties.description: Started SSL handshake in milliseconds relative to fetchStart.

properties.name: requestStart
properties.description: Started sending request in milliseconds relative to fetchStart.

properties.name: responseStart
properties.description: Started receiving response headers in milliseconds relative to fetchStart.

properties.name: responseEnd
properties.description: Finished receiving response headers in milliseconds relative to fetchStart.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Request URL.

properties.name: method
properties.description: HTTP request method.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: HTTP request headers.

properties.name: postData
properties.description: HTTP POST request data.

properties.name: referrerPolicy
properties.description: The level of included referrer information.

properties.name: integrity
properties.description: The base64 cryptographic hash of the resource.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Response URL. This URL can be different from CachedResource.url in case of redirect.

properties.name: status
properties.description: HTTP response status code.

properties.name: statusText
properties.description: HTTP response status text.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: HTTP response headers.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: Resource mimeType as determined by the browser.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Specifies where the response came from.

properties.name: requestHeaders
properties.description: Refined HTTP request headers that were actually transmitted over the network.

properties.name: timing
properties.description: Timing information for the given request.

properties.name: security
properties.description: The security information for the given request.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: Network protocol. ALPN Protocol ID Identification Sequence, as per RFC 7301 (for example, http/2, http/1.1, spdy/3.1)

properties.name: priority
properties.description: Network priority.

properties.name: connectionIdentifier
properties.description: Connection identifier.

properties.name: remoteAddress
properties.description: Remote IP address.

properties.name: requestHeaders
properties.description: Refined HTTP request headers that were actually transmitted over the network.

properties.name: requestHeaderBytesSent
properties.description: Total HTTP request header bytes sent over the network.

properties.name: requestBodyBytesSent
properties.description: Total HTTP request body bytes sent over the network.

properties.name: responseHeaderBytesReceived
properties.description: Total HTTP response header bytes received over the network.

properties.name: responseBodyBytesReceived
properties.description: Total HTTP response body bytes received over the network.

properties.name: responseBodyDecodedSize
properties.description: Total decoded response body size in bytes.

properties.name: securityConnection
properties.description: Connection information for the completed request.

properties.name: isProxyConnection
properties.description: Whether or not the connection was proxied through a server. If true, the remoteAddress will be for the proxy server, not the server that provided the resource to the proxy server.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: HTTP response headers.

properties.name: status
properties.description: HTTP response status code.

properties.name: statusText
properties.description: HTTP response status text.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: HTTP response headers.

properties.name: opcode
properties.description: WebSocket frame opcode.

properties.name: mask
properties.description: WebSocket frame mask.

properties.name: payloadData
properties.description: WebSocket frame payload data, binary frames (opcode = 2) are base64-encoded.

properties.name: payloadLength
properties.description: WebSocket frame payload length in bytes.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Resource URL. This is the url of the original network request.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of this resource.

properties.name: response
properties.description: Cached response data.

properties.name: bodySize
properties.description: Cached response body size.

properties.name: sourceMapURL
properties.description: URL of source map associated with this resource (if any).

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of this initiator.

properties.name: stackTrace
properties.description: Initiator JavaScript stack trace, set for Script only.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Initiator URL, set for Parser type only.

properties.name: lineNumber
properties.description: Initiator line number, set for Parser type only.

properties.name: nodeId
properties.description: Set if the load was triggered by a DOM node, in addition to the other initiator information.

types.description: Different stages of a network request.
Different stages of a network request.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables network tracking, network events will now be delivered to the client.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables network tracking, prevents network events from being sent to the client.

commands.name: setExtraHTTPHeaders
commands.description: Specifies whether to always send extra HTTP headers with the requests from this page.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: Map with extra HTTP headers.

commands.name: getResponseBody
commands.description: Returns content served for the given request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier of the network request to get content for.

returns.name: base64Encoded
returns.description: True, if content was sent as base64.

commands.name: setResourceCachingDisabled
commands.description: Toggles whether the resource cache may be used when loading resources in the inspected page. If true, the resource cache will not be used when loading resources.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: Whether to prevent usage of the resource cache.

commands.name: loadResource
commands.description: Loads a resource in the context of a frame on the inspected page without cross origin checks.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame to load the resource from.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resource to load.

commands.name: getSerializedCertificate
commands.description: Fetches a serialized secure certificate for the given requestId to be displayed via InspectorFrontendHost.showCertificate.

returns.name: serializedCertificate
returns.description: Represents a base64 encoded WebCore::CertificateInfo object.

commands.name: resolveWebSocket
commands.description: Resolves JavaScript WebSocket object for given request id.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier of the WebSocket resource to resolve.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name that can be used to release multiple objects.

returns.name: object
returns.description: JavaScript object wrapper for given node.

commands.name: setInterceptionEnabled
commands.description: Enable interception of network requests.

commands.name: addInterception
commands.description: Add an interception.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL pattern to intercept, intercept everything if not specified or empty

parameters.name: stage
parameters.description: Stage to intercept.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: If false, ignores letter casing of `url` parameter.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: If true, treats `url` parameter as a regular expression.

commands.name: removeInterception
commands.description: Remove an interception.

parameters.name: stage
parameters.description: Stage to intercept.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: If false, ignores letter casing of `url` parameter.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: If true, treats `url` parameter as a regular expression.

commands.name: interceptContinue
commands.description: Continue request or response without modifications.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier for the intercepted Network request or response to continue.

parameters.name: stage
parameters.description: Stage to continue.

commands.name: interceptWithRequest
commands.description: Replace intercepted request with the provided one.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier for the intercepted Network request or response to continue.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: HTTP request url.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: HTTP request method.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: HTTP response headers. Pass through original values if unmodified.

parameters.name: postData
parameters.description: HTTP POST request data, base64-encoded.

commands.name: interceptWithResponse
commands.description: Provide response content for an intercepted response.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier for the intercepted Network response to modify.

parameters.name: base64Encoded
parameters.description: True, if content was sent as base64.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: MIME Type for the data.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: HTTP response status code. Pass through original values if unmodified.

parameters.name: statusText
parameters.description: HTTP response status text. Pass through original values if unmodified.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: HTTP response headers. Pass through original values if unmodified.

commands.name: interceptRequestWithResponse
commands.description: Provide response for an intercepted request. Request completely bypasses the network in this case and is immediately fulfilled with the provided data.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier for the intercepted Network response to modify.

parameters.name: base64Encoded
parameters.description: True, if content was sent as base64.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: MIME Type for the data.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: HTTP response status code.

parameters.name: statusText
parameters.description: HTTP response status text.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: HTTP response headers.

commands.name: interceptRequestWithError
commands.description: Fail request with given error type.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier for the intercepted Network request to fail.

parameters.name: errorType
parameters.description: Deliver error reason for the request failure.

commands.name: setEmulatedConditions
commands.description: Emulate various network conditions (e.g. bytes per second, latency, etc.).

parameters.name: bytesPerSecondLimit
parameters.description: Limits the bytes per second of requests if positive. Removes any limits if zero or not provided.

events.name: requestWillBeSent
events.description: Fired when page is about to send HTTP request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame identifier.

parameters.name: loaderId
parameters.description: Loader identifier.

parameters.name: documentURL
parameters.description: URL of the document this request is loaded for.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Request data.

parameters.name: initiator
parameters.description: Request initiator.

parameters.name: redirectResponse
parameters.description: Redirect response data.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Resource type.

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: Identifier for the context of where the load originated. In general this is the target identifier. For Workers this will be the workerId.

events.name: responseReceived
events.description: Fired when HTTP response is available.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame identifier.

parameters.name: loaderId
parameters.description: Loader identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Resource type.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: Response data.

events.name: dataReceived
events.description: Fired when data chunk was received over the network.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: dataLength
parameters.description: Data chunk length.

parameters.name: encodedDataLength
parameters.description: Actual bytes received (might be less than dataLength for compressed encodings).

events.name: loadingFinished
events.description: Fired when HTTP request has finished loading.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: sourceMapURL
parameters.description: URL of source map associated with this resource (if any).

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: Network metrics.

events.name: loadingFailed
events.description: Fired when HTTP request has failed to load.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: errorText
parameters.description: User friendly error message.

parameters.name: canceled
parameters.description: True if loading was canceled.

events.name: requestServedFromMemoryCache
events.description: Fired when HTTP request has been served from memory cache.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame identifier.

parameters.name: loaderId
parameters.description: Loader identifier.

parameters.name: documentURL
parameters.description: URL of the document this request is loaded for.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: initiator
parameters.description: Request initiator.

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Cached resource data.

events.name: requestIntercepted
events.description: Fired when HTTP request has been intercepted. The frontend must respond with Network.interceptContinue, Network.interceptWithRequest` or Network.interceptWithResponse` to resolve this request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier for this intercepted network. Corresponds with an earlier Network.requestWillBeSent.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Original request content that would proceed if this is continued.

events.name: responseIntercepted
events.description: Fired when HTTP response has been intercepted. The frontend must response with Network.interceptContinue or Network.interceptWithResponse` to continue this response.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier for this intercepted network. Corresponds with an earlier Network.requestWillBeSent.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: Original response content that would proceed if this is continued.

events.name: webSocketWillSendHandshakeRequest
events.description: Fired when WebSocket is about to initiate handshake.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: WebSocket request data.

events.name: webSocketHandshakeResponseReceived
events.description: Fired when WebSocket handshake response becomes available.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: WebSocket response data.

events.name: webSocketCreated
events.description: Fired upon WebSocket creation.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: WebSocket request URL.

events.name: webSocketClosed
events.description: Fired when WebSocket is closed.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

events.name: webSocketFrameReceived
events.description: Fired when WebSocket frame is received.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: WebSocket response data.

events.name: webSocketFrameError
events.description: Fired when WebSocket frame error occurs.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.description: WebSocket frame error message.

events.name: webSocketFrameSent
events.description: Fired when WebSocket frame is sent.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: WebSocket response data.

domains.description: Runtime domain exposes JavaScript runtime by means of remote evaluation and mirror objects. Evaluation results are returned as mirror object that expose object type, string representation and unique identifier that can be used for further object reference. Original objects are maintained in memory unless they are either explicitly released or are released along with the other objects in their object group.

types.description: Mirror object referencing original JavaScript object.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Object type.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object function (for class) type values only.

properties.name: className
properties.description: Object class (constructor) name. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Remote object value (in case of primitive values or JSON values if it was requested).

properties.name: description
properties.description: String representation of the object.

properties.name: objectId
properties.description: Unique object identifier (for non-primitive values).

properties.name: size
properties.description: Size of the array/collection. Specified for array/map/set/weakmap/weakset object type values only.

properties.name: classPrototype
properties.description: Remote object for the class prototype. Specified for class object type values only.

properties.name: preview
properties.description: Preview containing abbreviated property values. Specified for object type values only.

types.description: Object containing abbreviated remote object value.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Object type.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: description
properties.description: String representation of the object.

properties.name: lossless
properties.description: Determines whether preview is lossless (contains all information of the original object).

properties.name: overflow
properties.description: True iff some of the properties of the original did not fit.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: List of the properties.

properties.name: entries
properties.description: List of the entries. Specified for map and set subtype values only.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Size of the array/collection. Specified for array/map/set/weakmap/weakset object type values only.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Property name.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Object type.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: User-friendly property value string.

properties.name: valuePreview
properties.description: Nested value preview.

properties.name: isPrivate
properties.description: True if this is a private field.

properties.name: internal
properties.description: True if this is an internal property.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Entry key. Specified for map-like collection entries.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Entry value.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Entry key of a map-like collection, otherwise not provided.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Entry value.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Property name or symbol description.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

properties.name: writable
properties.description: True if the value associated with the property may be changed (data descriptors only).

properties.name: get
properties.description: A function which serves as a getter for the property, or undefined if there is no getter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: set
properties.description: A function which serves as a setter for the property, or undefined if there is no setter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: wasThrown
properties.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

properties.name: configurable
properties.description: True if the type of this property descriptor may be changed and if the property may be deleted from the corresponding object.

properties.name: enumerable
properties.description: True if this property shows up during enumeration of the properties on the corresponding object.

properties.name: isOwn
properties.description: True if the property is owned for the object.

properties.name: symbol
properties.description: Property symbol object, if the property is a symbol.

properties.name: isPrivate
properties.description: True if the property is a private field.

properties.name: nativeGetter
properties.description: True if the property value came from a native getter.

types.description: Object internal property descriptor. This property isn't normally visible in JavaScript code.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Conventional property name.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

types.description: Represents function call argument. Either remote object id objectId or primitive value or neither of (for undefined) them should be specified.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Primitive value.

properties.name: objectId
properties.description: Remote object handle.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique id of the execution context. It can be used to specify in which execution context script evaluation should be performed.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Human readable name describing given context.

properties.name: frameId
properties.description: Id of the owning frame.

types.description: Syntax error type: "none" for no error, "irrecoverable" for unrecoverable errors, "unterminated-literal" for when there is an unterminated literal, "recoverable" for when the expression is unfinished but valid so far.
Range of an error in source code.

properties.name: startOffset
properties.description: Start offset of range (inclusive).

properties.name: endOffset
properties.description: End offset of range (exclusive).

properties.name: fields
properties.description: Array of strings, where the strings represent object properties.

properties.name: optionalFields
properties.description: Array of strings, where the strings represent optional object properties.

properties.name: constructorName
properties.description: Name of the constructor.

properties.name: prototypeStructure
properties.description: Pointer to the StructureRepresentation of the protoype if one exists.

properties.name: isImprecise
properties.description: If true, it indicates that the fields in this StructureDescription may be inaccurate. I.e, there might have been fields that have been deleted before it was profiled or it has fields we haven't profiled.

properties.name: isFunction
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type Function.

properties.name: isUndefined
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type Undefined.

properties.name: isNull
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type Null.

properties.name: isBoolean
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type Boolean.

properties.name: isInteger
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type Integer.

properties.name: isNumber
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type Number.

properties.name: isString
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type String.

properties.name: isObject
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type Object.

properties.name: isSymbol
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type Symbol.

properties.name: isBigInt
properties.description: Indicates if this type description has been type BigInt.

types.description: Container for type information that has been gathered.

properties.name: isValid
properties.description: If true, we were able to correlate the offset successfuly with a program location. If false, the offset may be bogus or the offset may be from a CodeBlock that hasn't executed.

properties.name: leastCommonAncestor
properties.description: Least common ancestor of all Constructors if the TypeDescription has seen any structures. This string is the display name of the shared constructor function.

properties.name: typeSet
properties.description: Set of booleans for determining the aggregate type of this type description.

properties.name: structures
properties.description: Array of descriptions for all structures seen for this variable.

properties.name: isTruncated
properties.description: If true, this indicates that no more structures are being profiled because some maximum threshold has been reached and profiling has stopped because of memory pressure.

types.description: Describes the location of an expression we want type information for.

properties.name: typeInformationDescriptor
properties.description: What kind of type information do we want (normal, function return values, 'this' statement).

properties.name: sourceID
properties.description: sourceID uniquely identifying a script

properties.name: divot
properties.description: character offset for assignment range

types.description: From Wikipedia: a basic block is a portion of the code within a program with only one entry point and only one exit point. This type gives the location of a basic block and if that basic block has executed.

properties.name: startOffset
properties.description: Start offset of the basic block.

properties.name: endOffset
properties.description: End offset of the basic block.

properties.name: hasExecuted
properties.description: Indicates if the basic block has executed before.

properties.name: executionCount
properties.description: Indicates how many times the basic block has executed.

commands.name: parse
commands.description: Parses JavaScript source code for errors.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source code to parse.

returns.name: range
returns.description: Range in the source where the error occurred.

commands.name: evaluate
commands.description: Evaluates expression on global object.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: Expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name that can be used to release multiple objects.

parameters.name: includeCommandLineAPI
parameters.description: Determines whether Command Line API should be available during the evaluation.

parameters.name: doNotPauseOnExceptionsAndMuteConsole
parameters.description: Specifies whether evaluation should stop on exceptions and mute console. Overrides setPauseOnException state.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Specifies in which isolated context to perform evaluation. Each content script lives in an isolated context and this parameter may be used to specify one of those contexts. If the parameter is omitted or 0 the evaluation will be performed in the context of the inspected page.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object that should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

parameters.name: saveResult
parameters.description: Whether the resulting value should be considered for saving in the $n history.

parameters.name: emulateUserGesture
parameters.description: Whether the expression should be considered to be in a user gesture or not.

returns.name: wasThrown
returns.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

returns.name: savedResultIndex
returns.description: If the result was saved, this is the $n index that can be used to access the value.

commands.name: awaitPromise
commands.description: Calls the async callback when the promise with the given ID gets settled.

parameters.name: promiseObjectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the promise.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object that should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

parameters.name: saveResult
parameters.description: Whether the resulting value should be considered for saving in the $n history.

returns.name: wasThrown
returns.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

returns.name: savedResultIndex
returns.description: If the result was saved, this is the $n index that can be used to access the value.

commands.name: callFunctionOn
commands.description: Calls function with given declaration on the given object. Object group of the result is inherited from the target object.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to call function on.

parameters.name: functionDeclaration
parameters.description: Declaration of the function to call.

parameters.name: arguments
parameters.description: Call arguments. All call arguments must belong to the same JavaScript world as the target object.

parameters.name: doNotPauseOnExceptionsAndMuteConsole
parameters.description: Specifies whether function call should stop on exceptions and mute console. Overrides setPauseOnException state.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object which should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

parameters.name: emulateUserGesture
parameters.description: Whether the expression should be considered to be in a user gesture or not.

returns.name: wasThrown
returns.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

commands.name: getPreview
commands.description: Returns a preview for the given object.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to return a preview for.

commands.name: getProperties
commands.description: Returns properties of a given object. Object group of the result is inherited from the target object.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to return properties for.

parameters.name: ownProperties
parameters.description: If true, returns properties belonging only to the object itself, not to its prototype chain.

parameters.name: fetchStart
parameters.description: If provided skip to this value before collecting values. Otherwise, start at the beginning. Has no effect when the `objectId` is for a `iterator`/`WeakMap`/`WeakSet` object.

parameters.name: fetchCount
parameters.description: If provided only return `fetchCount` values. Otherwise, return values all the way to the end.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for property values.

returns.name: internalProperties
returns.description: Internal object properties. Only included if `fetchStart` is 0.

commands.name: getDisplayableProperties
commands.description: Returns displayable properties of a given object. Object group of the result is inherited from the target object. Displayable properties are own properties, internal properties, and native getters in the prototype chain (assumed to be bindings and treated like own properties for the frontend).

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to return properties for.

parameters.name: fetchStart
parameters.description: If provided skip to this value before collecting values. Otherwise, start at the beginning. Has no effect when the `objectId` is for a `iterator`/`WeakMap`/`WeakSet` object.

parameters.name: fetchCount
parameters.description: If provided only return `fetchCount` values. Otherwise, return values all the way to the end.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for property values.

returns.name: internalProperties
returns.description: Internal object properties. Only included if `fetchStart` is 0.

commands.name: getCollectionEntries
commands.description: Returns entries of given Map / Set collection.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Id of the collection to get entries for.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name that can be used to release multiple. If not provided, it will be the same objectGroup as the RemoteObject determined from objectId. This is useful for WeakMap to release the collection entries.

parameters.name: fetchStart
parameters.description: If provided skip to this value before collecting values. Otherwise, start at the beginning. Has no effect when the `objectId<` is for a `iterator<`/`WeakMap<`/`WeakSet<` object.

parameters.name: fetchCount
parameters.description: If provided only return `fetchCount` values. Otherwise, return values all the way to the end.

commands.name: saveResult
commands.description: Assign a saved result index to this value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Id or value of the object to save.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Unique id of the execution context. To specify in which execution context script evaluation should be performed. If not provided, determine from the CallArgument's objectId.

returns.name: savedResultIndex
returns.description: If the value was saved, this is the $n index that can be used to access the value.

commands.name: setSavedResultAlias
commands.description: Creates an additional reference to all saved values in the Console using the the given string as a prefix instead of $.

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description: Passing an empty/null string will clear the alias.

commands.name: releaseObject
commands.description: Releases remote object with given id.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to release.

commands.name: releaseObjectGroup
commands.description: Releases all remote objects that belong to a given group.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic object group name.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables reporting of execution contexts creation by means of executionContextCreated event. When the reporting gets enabled the event will be sent immediately for each existing execution context.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables reporting of execution contexts creation.

commands.name: getRuntimeTypesForVariablesAtOffsets
commands.description: Returns detailed information on the given function.

parameters.name: locations
parameters.description: An array of type locations we're requesting information for. Results are expected in the same order they're sent in.

commands.name: enableTypeProfiler
commands.description: Enables type profiling on the VM.

commands.name: disableTypeProfiler
commands.description: Disables type profiling on the VM.

commands.name: enableControlFlowProfiler
commands.description: Enables control flow profiling on the VM.

commands.name: disableControlFlowProfiler
commands.description: Disables control flow profiling on the VM.

commands.name: getBasicBlocks
commands.description: Returns a list of basic blocks for the given sourceID with information about their text ranges and whether or not they have executed.

parameters.name: sourceID
parameters.description: Indicates which sourceID information is requested for.

events.name: executionContextCreated
events.description: Issued when new execution context is created.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: A newly created execution context.

domains.description: Profiler domain exposes JavaScript evaluation timing and profiling.

properties.name: line
properties.description: 1-based.

properties.name: column
properties.description: 1-based.

properties.name: sourceID
properties.description: Unique script identifier.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A displayable name for the stack frame. i.e function name, (program), etc.

properties.name: line
properties.description: -1 if unavailable. 1-based if available.

properties.name: column
properties.description: -1 if unavailable. 1-based if available.

properties.name: stackFrames
properties.description: First array item is the bottom of the call stack and last array item is the top of the call stack.

commands.name: startTracking
commands.description: Start tracking script evaluations.

parameters.name: includeSamples
parameters.description: Start the sampling profiler, defaults to false.

commands.name: stopTracking
commands.description: Stop tracking script evaluations. This will produce a `trackingComplete` event.

events.name: trackingStart
events.description: Tracking started.

events.name: trackingUpdate
events.description: Periodic tracking updates with event data.

events.name: trackingComplete
events.description: Tracking stopped. Includes any buffered data during tracking, such as profiling information.

parameters.name: samples
parameters.description: Stack traces.
